Posts.Content: Jhigs81 wrote: Hi ladies I'm hoping someone can give me some advice on how I should proceed. A little background, in 2013 I had an excisional biopsy for an unknown lump in right breast. It was B9 thank goodness. This week I had my regular yearly well women check and the doctor decided to send me for a mammo and US. I have what looks to be a bruise on left breast for 2 months and a lump under my scar on right breast. She wanted to make sure it was normal scar tissue. My ultrasound results show two lesions in right breast. Circumscribed edges. One is 16x7x10 ISO-to hypoechoic and the second smaller lesion is oval. No doppler flow. Left breast under bruise is a subtle 4x1 hypoechoic focus. Birads 3. I know a three is most likely b9. With a family history of 1 aunt with bc. I'm debating on waiting the six months or pushing for a biopsy for peace of mind. Does anyone know what the ISO in front if hypoechoic means? I think it means normal breast tissue? Thank you for any advice Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Confused on next steps Jhigs81 Jhigs81

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2017 06:32AM Jhigs81 wrote: Thank you! I actually didn't even think of an MRI as an option. I'll ask my doctor tomorrow about that. She's awesome and even mentioned if this report was hers she'd also push for a few more answers so I think she'd consider it. I really appreciate the support from you ladies.
Posts.Title: Confused on next steps Jhigs81 Jhigs81

Posts.Content: Jhigs81 wrote: Hi I'm a new user and actually I've never posted on a forum before but I'm pretty conflicted.  My story started when I noticed my right breast was drooping more than usual and pointing in a different direction than the left.  I also noticed a very very light bruise.  This was about 3 months ago.  I kept an eye on it and then I started getting shooting pains into the center of my breast from my armpit.  I went to my OB/GYN and she sent me for a mammogram.  My first one ever since I'm 31.  That came back benign but noted I have dense fibrocystic breasts.  I waited about 3 more weeks and went back because it was not getting better.  This time my OB/GYN noticed a lump.  She sent me for a diagnostic ultrasound and another mammogram.  The woman doing the us asked if I had been in a car accident because of the bruise (I have not been, nor have I been injured at all).  She said she saw no lump at all on either test and sent me on my way.  I waited 2 more months and the lump seemed bigger to me so I went back to my OB/GYN.  She said it does seem bigger and referred me to a breast surgeon to have it removed.  Yesterday I saw the surgeon.  She was able to feel the lump when I was sitting up and did an ultrasound.  She saw only what she called a ridge on ultrasound and felt that was normal.  She did agree to perform an open excision and biopsy the ridge to ease my mind.  My questions are, is it possible there is a lump there since I can feel it and the doctors can feel it but not been seen on these tests?  Also, has anyone else had this experience with the ridge?  I've not been able to find much information on it.  The lump does not feel like a ridge.  It feels like a lump attached to something (which might be the ridge I guess).  I feel uneasy about surgery when everyone is making me feel crazy by saying there is no lump in the tests.  My family history is pretty clear except my mother's sister who did have breast cancer caught very early. Thank you for any suggestions/opinions! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Hiding Lump Jhigs81 Jhigs81

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2013 12:29PM Jhigs81 wrote: Hi Deanna  Thank you for the encouragement.  Having the surgery was actually a much tougher decision than I expected it to be.  I talked to my surgeon today and the surgery is scheduled for Nov 14th.  She is not doing a punch test as she was not worried about the bruising and said if I had IBC it would not look like a light bruise.  I did ask about IBC specifically in my visit but the bruising is so very light that no one seems concerned about it but me.  Thanks again for the support.  I was feeling like a crazy person.  :)
Posts.Title: Hiding Lump Jhigs81 Jhigs81

Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2013 03:59PM Jhigs81 wrote: Just wanted to post an update. I had the surgery. All went well. Resting at home for a few days now. The surgeon ended up removing what she referred to as a "walnut" as well as more tissue around it. So I assume the ridge turned out to be the walnut. She told my husband it looked b9 to her. Not sure if she can tell that from looking during surgery but it made his anxiety lessen so that's good. Now just waiting for pathology and praying!
Posts.Title: Hiding Lump Jhigs81 Jhigs81
